page.title: 20Cold Brayfield, General
page.content: Cold Brayfield (population around 70) is a cluster of farm buildings and cottages belonging to the Brayfield Estate, which has been in the same family since 1648. Brayfield House has a Regency front but the older Queen Anne manor house can be seen from the back. Requisitioned by the Royal Ordnance Corps in the 1939-45 War, today the house is divided into 8 flats. It is said to be haunted by the White Lady since her grave was robbed 100 years ago. The farm is mixed-arable, beef cattle and sheep. Local schoolchildren are regularly taken on farm walks at various times of the year. The Church of St. Mary, is a small, early English structure with some Norman work. It was completely restored in 1881.
